description: Coined by WH Sheldon, from viscero- +â€Ž tonic.

adjectives.description: viscerotonic (comparative more viscerotonic, superlative most viscerotonic)

entries.meaning: Designating a personality type characterised as sociable, easy-going, and comfort-seeking.
A person with such a personality.
examples: Joffre was a true viscerotonic, and this was the source of his principal strengths and weaknesses.
